So and so happened that I realized I was being scammed and I even lost my account to him. I found out from my friend that he was impersonating a large trader that I had no idea of. So I didn't have access to my account, my items, or anything. My friend from school went to check on my account for me and he saw that it was being used to impersonate another big trader. This worried me as I knew I would obviously get trade banned soon to some extent so I tried to get it back. I messaged my older brother who helped contact steam for me which allowed him to change the password keeping the scammer out. I got my account back but I was marked as a scammer. Since I was really into trading, this upset me because I had lost all my items to this scammer and I'm most likely not going to be trusted on most trading sites. Hopefully the evidence I can provide below will suffice. The evidence is the account that impersonated someone by the name of Mr.Omani and seeing that hes been trade banned. "},{"id":436,"type":"Other / another reason ","appellant":"76561198158605267 (EmeralMage)","alts":"","description":"[b]Why?[/b] I would like to attempt to appeal to the FoG website for one final time, seeing as it reuins any of my reputation. Even as a non-trader, it would be bad to continue to hold this reputation moving foreward. It was unclear to me whether or not I remain eligible to appeal, so I think this will be my final attempt. [b]What happened?[/b] I do not remember exactly when, but years ago I had tried to impersonate a middleman. There is no good excuse for attempting to impersonate a middleman. I do recall having the intention of gaining items through scamming people, although I never once did participate in requesting items from anybody, nor did I attempt to be an active middleman in any trades. Still, this is wrong, and I, now matured (albeit seldom), can fully understand why I was reprimanded and banned by FoG from the beginning. [b]Why should I be appealed?[/b] It has been many years since those days when I attempted to impersonate a middleman. I still hold it true that I did not lie during any of my previous appeals. I did not trade wrongfully; did not ask anyone for items. I did, however, still change my name. I understand that FoG had still obtained substansial evidence to convict me as a scammer, but I continue to think that my application was wrongfully rejected. I think that my original application was misinterpreted, and I hope to convince the moderators of this site that, now, I am able to be trusted as a regular steam player. [b]My apology[/b] Once again, I was much, much younger when my original banning and appeals transpired. In a wave of anger and foolishness I continued to remake appeals over and over because I thought I had been misunderstood. I personally wish to apologize to any admin who had to deal with the numerous appeals I submitted in my fit/tantrum. I understand if this application is immediately designed as a result of my previous ones, but I hope that the moderators may be able to sympathize with me. I hope that I have not precluded any chance of appeal. *Note I didn't know what to list this appeal under, because I think that it is multiple reasons. Primarily: -Mistake/Admin misunderstood (Not the fault of the admin) -Change of Heart I have no evidence other than my steam profile. The alternate name of the middleman I impersonated has been removed and I now don my own unique profile features. I now have many more hours and the age of my account can be seen. If anything seems insufficient, or lacking clarity, please let me know. I will do my best to explain anything that is unclear or that you think may be able to be misinterpreted. [u]https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198158605267[/u] Thank you for reading, moderator. I understand that you are doing the best for the Steam and Trading Communities --EmeralMage","evidence":"","assignee_id":null,"state_id":7,"views":544,"locked":1,"creator_id":152,"modificator_id":152,"created_at":"20.01.2020 02:56:19","updated_at":"2020-01-20 03:01:10","state":"Archived","assignee":"
